intro: Cyrtandra listeri, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often found in the understory of native Hawaiian forests. Cyrtandra listeri has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract various pollinators. It is considered an endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species competition.
